channel.title: Can't host a server, why?
channel.description:
Okay. I have portforwarded and made the no-ip host and downloaded the DUC. Also I changed the ip in my server. I did search name like "server =" and "serverIP". And i found and replaced the ips. But when i chenge the ip of client I can't log in. And when I change it back to "127.0.0.1" it works again. So where is the problem?
Please help me. I really want to host my the first RSPS!

item.title: Can't host a server, why?
item.dc:creator: @Broke Broke
item.description:
@Broke wrote:

I tried with uTorrent and without uTorrent. Didn’t work

Read full topic

item.title: Can't host a server, why?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

if you portforwarded with router you don’t even need utorrent, if your having trouble logging into the client its probably because you have utorrent up?

Read full topic

item.title: Can't host a server, why?
item.dc:creator: @Broke Broke
item.description:
@Broke wrote:

I have portforwarded with router and with uTorrent. And the port is open I tested. And I know how to host a server but I don’t know why this won’t work? I think I do everything rigth.

I try what Your Master said.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't host a server, why?
item.dc:creator: @flare2555 flare2555
item.description:
@flare2555 wrote:

[quote=“Broke, post:1, topic:430594”]Okay. I have portforwarded and made the no-ip host and downloaded the DUC. Also I changed the ip in my server. I did search name like “server =” and “serverIP”. And i found and replaced the ips. But when i chenge the ip of client I can’t log in. And when I change it back to “127.0.0.1” it works again. So where is the problem?

Please help me. I really want to host my the first RSPS![/quote]

You have to set it to the no-ip, then turn that into a .rar file, and upload it somewhere. That’s how other people play it, but if you want to play it change the one on your desktop back to the 127.0.0.1, and give other people the link where you uploaded it to, try mediafire.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't host a server, why?
item.dc:creator: @RSPS_XGen RSPS XGen
item.description:
@RSPS_XGen wrote:

If you are using utorrent to open the port, in the bottom right corner click and check the fowarded port, did you allow it through your firewall? also, like the post above me, try using just your ip. Whatismyip.org

Read full topic

item.title: Can't host a server, why?
item.dc:creator: @bibbobbib bibbobbib
item.description:
@bibbobbib wrote:

are you using delta or pi? or something else.
if its pi you only need to change the second ip to your no-ip in client.java
it its delta i dunno cus i remember trying but it never worked for me
if that dont work then i dunno what, im no pro

Read full topic

item.title: Can't host a server, why?
item.dc:creator: @Your_Master Your Master
item.description:
@Your_Master wrote:

Try don’t using No-IP and using your real IP. Also do you run on a router or a LAN-cable? If you’re running on a LAN cable, you don’t have to portforward, however if you do run on a router you portforwarded wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't host a server, why?
item.dc:creator: @Broke Broke
